d.description: Initial multibuffer implementation - types, tests, benchmarks
d.name: multibuffer-v0

d.description: Create types.ts with Buffer, Excerpt, MultiBuffer, Anchor, Selection types. Focus on the data model, not implementation.
d.title: Define core types for multibuffer

d.description: Create types.ts for multibuffer_renderer with Renderer interface, Measurement, Viewport types. Keep rendering-agnostic.
d.title: Define renderer interface types

d.description: Configure bun test, create test helpers, establish testing patterns for the project.
d.title: Set up test infrastructure

d.description: Create benchmark harness with timing utilities, memory measurement, and reporting. Target: validate <1ms operations.
d.title: Set up benchmark infrastructure

d.description: Test buffer creation, text insertion, deletion, line access. Tests before implementation.
d.title: Write tests for Buffer operations

d.description: Test excerpt creation, range validation, anchor stability. Tests before implementation.
d.title: Write tests for Excerpt operations

d.description: Test multibuffer with multiple excerpts, cross-excerpt navigation, viewport calculations. Tests before implementation.
d.title: Write tests for MultiBuffer operations

d.description: Benchmark: buffer creation, excerpt operations, viewport calculations, position lookups. Validate <1ms targets.
d.title: Write performance benchmarks

d.description: Core data model: Buffer, Excerpt, MultiBuffer, snapshots
d.name: core-data-structures

d.description: Position translation between coordinate spaces (MultiBuffer ↔ Excerpt ↔ Buffer)
d.name: position-conversion

d.description: Stable position references that survive edits and excerpt replacements
d.name: anchor-system

d.description: Excerpt lifecycle: add, remove, expand, replace, merge
d.name: excerpt-management

d.description: Critical edge cases, boundary conditions, and footguns from Zed research
d.name: edge-cases-gotchas

d.description: Uniform list virtualization, visible range calculation, scroll handling
d.name: viewport-rendering

d.description: Store lines as string array. Methods: snapshot(), insert(), delete(), replace(). Immutable snapshots for concurrent reads.
d.title: Implement Buffer with line array storage

d.description: line(row), lines(start,end), text(), pointToOffset(), offsetToPoint(). Fixed-height constraint means simple array indexing.
d.title: Implement BufferSnapshot with O(1) line access

d.description: Track: lineCount, charCount, lastLineLength. Cache per-excerpt for O(1) lookups. Update incrementally on edits.
d.title: Implement TextSummary aggregation

d.description: ExcerptId, BufferId, range (context + primary), startRow, endRow. Reference to BufferSnapshot, NOT copy.
d.title: Implement Excerpt with range and buffer reference

d.description: excerpts array (sorted by position), lineCount derived from excerpts. Methods: addExcerpt(), removeExcerpt(), excerptAt().
d.title: Implement MultiBuffer with excerpt list

d.description: Copy-on-write pattern. Snapshots survive mutations. Anchors can reference old snapshots safely.
d.title: Implement MultiBufferSnapshot immutable view

d.description: Flag for single-buffer single-excerpt case. Skip traversal for common case. CRITICAL: must maintain correctly or lookups fail.
d.title: Implement singleton optimization flag

d.description: MultiBuffer offset → Excerpt offset → Buffer offset. Design the dimension conversion pattern from Zed.
d.title: Implement 3-layer position translation model

d.description: Given MultiBufferPoint, find containing excerpt, calculate overshoot, return BufferPoint. O(log n) via binary search.
d.title: Implement toBufferPoint conversion

d.description: Given ExcerptId + BufferPoint, calculate MultiBufferPoint. Must handle clipping to excerpt bounds.
d.title: Implement toMultiBufferPoint conversion

d.description: Convert between Point (row, col) and byte offset. Fixed-height lines make row calculation O(1), but column still needs line access.
d.title: Implement pointToOffset and offsetToPoint

d.description: Given MultiBufferRow, find containing excerpt via binary search. Must handle gaps between excerpts correctly.
d.title: Implement binary search for excerptAt

d.description: Bias.Left vs Bias.Right for boundary positions. clip_point must preserve bias when clamping to line/excerpt bounds.
d.title: Implement Bias enum and clipping

d.description: toBufferPoint(toMultiBufferPoint(p)) should return p or clipped equivalent. Test across excerpt boundaries.
d.title: Test position roundtrip invariants

d.description: Anchor = {excerptId, offset, bias}. Must survive: text edits, excerpt replacement, buffer mutations. Reference Zed's text::Anchor pattern.
d.title: Design Anchor data structure

d.description: Given MultiBufferPoint, create Anchor with correct excerptId and buffer offset. Bias determines insert behavior.
d.title: Implement anchor creation from position

d.description: Given Anchor, resolve to current MultiBufferPoint. Must follow replaced_excerpts chain if excerpt was replaced.
d.title: Implement anchor resolution to position

d.description: When excerpt is replaced, map old ExcerptId to new one. Anchors follow chain to find current valid excerpt.
d.title: Implement replaced_excerpts tracking

d.description: Create anchor, edit buffer, verify anchor resolves to logically same position. Test insert before/after/at anchor.
d.title: Test anchor survival through edits

d.description: Replace entire excerpt with new one. Anchor should degrade gracefully to nearest valid position.
d.title: Test anchor survival through excerpt replacement

d.description: Selection = {start: Anchor, end: Anchor, head: 'start'|'end'}. Both anchors must track independently.
d.title: Implement AnchorRange for selections

d.description: Add excerpt, calculate startRow based on preceding excerpts, update lineCount. Maintain sorted order.
d.title: Implement addExcerpt with position calculation

d.description: Remove excerpt, update startRow for all subsequent excerpts. CRITICAL: subsequent excerpt rows must shift up.
d.title: Implement removeExcerpt with row recalculation

d.description: If two ranges are adjacent (end.row + 1 == start.row) or overlapping, merge into single excerpt. Zed's merge_excerpt_ranges pattern.
d.title: Implement excerpt range merging

d.description: Expand excerpt by N lines in each direction. Must not exceed buffer bounds. Update all row calculations.
d.title: Implement expandExcerpt context lines

d.description: Replace all excerpts for a path in one operation. Amortizes tree rebuilds. Must track replaced_excerpts for anchor survival.
d.title: Implement setExcerptsForPath batch operation

d.description: IDs must be monotonically increasing, never reused. Required for anchor stability and binary search correctness.
d.title: Implement monotonic ExcerptId generation

d.description: Edit that spans multiple excerpts must: edit end of first, delete middles entirely, edit start of last. Complex case.
d.title: Test multi-excerpt edits spanning boundaries

d.description: Excerpts may have synthetic trailing newline. has_trailing_newline flag. When resolving: if flag set, end_before_newline -= 1. Off-by-one trap.
d.title: GOTCHA: Trailing newline handling

d.description: Excerpt can be empty (start == end). Still takes space in tree. Must handle in summary: if range.end > end_before_newline, add newline.
d.title: GOTCHA: Empty excerpt edge case

d.description: clip_point(Point(5,3), Bias.Right) on 2-char line must preserve right bias. Clip to end-of-line, not before. Delegates to buffer's clip_point(bias).
d.title: GOTCHA: Clipping must preserve Bias

d.description: IDs monotonically increase. Once assigned, NEVER reused even after removal. Anchors reference old IDs; replaced_excerpts tracks where they point.
d.title: GOTCHA: ExcerptId reuse prevention

d.description: If singleton flag is wrong, ALL position lookups fail. Must update on every add/remove. Consider lazy evaluation instead.
d.title: GOTCHA: Singleton flag must be maintained

d.description: Single empty buffer. lineCount=1 (one empty line). Anchors at position 0. From Zed's test_empty_singleton().
d.title: TEST: Empty singleton buffer

d.description: Multiple excerpts, all empty. Row calculations must be correct. From Zed's test_empty_multibuffer().
d.title: TEST: Empty multibuffer with excerpts

d.description: clip_point at excerpt boundaries. Row 5 exists but has no content in any excerpt. From test_excerpt_boundaries_and_clipping.
d.title: TEST: Excerpt boundary clipping

d.description: Replaces entire excerpt with new ones from different buffer. Tests latest_excerpt_id() mapping. Anchors degrade to nearest valid.
d.title: TEST: Anchor survival through replacement chain

d.description: In summaries_for_anchors(), cursor reused across iterations. seek_forward() is O(k), seek() is O(log n). Batch by excerpt.
d.title: PERF: Cursor state reuse for batch anchor resolution

d.description: Use binary search for excerptAt(). Linear scan kills performance with 100+ excerpts. Zed uses SumTree, we use sorted array + binary search.
d.title: PERF: Avoid O(n) excerpt traversal

d.description: Given scrollTop, viewportHeight, lineHeight, totalLines: calculate startRow and endRow. O(1) with fixed heights. Already benchmarked at 36M ops/sec.
d.title: Implement visible row range calculation

d.description: scrollTop must be clamped to [0, maxScroll]. maxScroll = contentHeight - viewportHeight. Handle edge case: viewport taller than content.
d.title: Implement scroll position clamping

d.description: ScrollStrategy: top, center, bottom, nearest. 'nearest' only scrolls if row not visible. From Zed's DeferredScrollToItem pattern.
d.title: Implement scrollToRow with strategy

d.description: Given (x, y) pixel coords, return {row, column}. row = floor(y / lineHeight). column = floor((x - gutterWidth) / charWidth).
d.title: Implement hitTest (pixel to row/column)

d.description: Excerpt boundaries need headers (file path, line range). Calculate which headers are visible in current viewport.
d.title: Implement excerpt header positioning

d.description: Decorations (highlights, selections) specified as MultiBufferRange. Map to pixel coordinates for rendering.
d.title: Implement decoration range mapping

d.description: Test: scrollTop=0, scrollTop=maxScroll, empty content, single line content. Edge cases from uniform_list tests.
d.title: TEST: Viewport at content boundaries

d.description: Test all strategies: top (row at viewport top), center (row centered), bottom (row at viewport bottom), nearest (minimal scroll).
d.title: TEST: scrollToRow strategies

d.description: Render callback receives only visible range. Do NOT create DOM/elements for non-visible lines. Core virtualization principle.
d.title: PERF: Only render visible lines
